time-based version. Integrates "stamina" and "fatigue" features into a single feature. Currently, player matches in denom factored 4th root, based on some prediction quality feedbck from simple (linear) model. It's a little counterintuitive, but a higher number indicates more "wear" on the battery (df_player1["p_tot_time_l7d_tw"])/(df_player1["p_matches_nss"]**(1/4))

entry type difference between the two players. Per player encoding  5: regular entry (ie, got in based on ranking), 4: direct entry, but for extenuating circumstances; 2.5: qualifier, 2: lucky loser (lost in qualifying, but still got in after a late withdrawal)

points-based version. Integrates "stamina" and "fatigue" features into a single feature. Currently, player matches in denom factored 4th root, based on some prediction quality feedbck from simple (linear) model. It's a little counterintuitive, but a higher number indicates more "wear" on the battery (df_player1["p_tot_pts_l7d_tw"])/(df_player1["p_matches_nss"]**(1/4))
